job_details.Vacaturetitel: Software Dev Engineer II, AWS IDEs
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Come join a creative team of software developers dedicated to making it more natural and intuitive to use AWS services from their favorite IDEs. In this position you'll craft high-quality open source software, understand customers, define user experiences and shape the future of IDEs for cloud development.

   You will help us define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful. We are defining new experiences that use generative AI to help developer be more productive in their IDEs, including CodeWhisperer. You will interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience. You will analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs. You'll also work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services. And you'll have the opportunity to learn and grow as an engineer.

   Key job responsibilities
   - Define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful.
   - Interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience.
   - Analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs.
   - Work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services.

   On-Call Responsibility: This position involves On-call responsibility. We work as a team to root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant.

   A day in the life
   Work/Life Harmony
   Our team gives high value to work-life harmony. Since the Covid19 pandemic we adjusted to remote work and established a hybrid work environment in which engineers spend 3 days working in the office, adjusted to the team needs.

   Mentorship & Career Growth
   We're committed to the growth and development of every member of the team, and that includes our development managers. As a senior software development engineer you will play a vital part in growing your peers. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the culture and direction and deliver site-wide initiatives that will improve the life of all of our teams. AWS is a growth environment - we are hiring and scaling rapidly to meet the needs of our customers. You'll have the opportunity to grow your scope of influence naturally as we scale and will have get to hire & develop other leaders along the way.

   About the team
   When we started building the IDE Toolkits team, we set out to create a place where engineers can deliver great work. That means finding and hiring people who value great engineering but who also value professional and personal relationships. We are a global business, so your ability to work with people with diverse viewpoints and backgrounds will be important. As software engineers, we need to balance a lot of things. To us, "agile" means balancing software craftsmanship, operational excellence, and delivering value to our customers - while also allowing the team to plan work and life in a predictable way, work hard without needless distractions or fire drills, and spend quality time away from work.

   We take risks, but we hold each other accountable for results and how the results were achieved. We have a long-term vision, but we don't do big designs up front. Our goals are clear and we are working on things that are important to everyone on the team… and to Amazon.
job_details.full_text:
Software Dev Engineer II, AWS IDEs

Come join a creative team of software developers dedicated to making it more natural and intuitive to use AWS services from their favorite IDEs. In this position you'll craft high-quality open source software, understand customers, define user experiences and shape the future of IDEs for cloud development.

   You will help us define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful. We are defining new experiences that use generative AI to help developer be more productive in their IDEs, including CodeWhisperer. You will interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience. You will analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs. You'll also work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services. And you'll have the opportunity to learn and grow as an engineer.

   Key job responsibilities
   - Define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful.
   - Interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience.
   - Analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs.
   - Work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services.

   On-Call Responsibility: This position involves On-call responsibility. We work as a team to root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant.

   A day in the life
   Work/Life Harmony
   Our team gives high value to work-life harmony. Since the Covid19 pandemic we adjusted to remote work and established a hybrid work environment in which engineers spend 3 days working in the office, adjusted to the team needs.

   Mentorship & Career Growth
   We're committed to the growth and development of every member of the team, and that includes our development managers. As a senior software development engineer you will play a vital part in growing your peers. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the culture and direction and deliver site-wide initiatives that will improve the life of all of our teams. AWS is a growth environment - we are hiring and scaling rapidly to meet the needs of our customers. You'll have the opportunity to grow your scope of influence naturally as we scale and will have get to hire & develop other leaders along the way.

   About the team
   When we started building the IDE Toolkits team, we set out to create a place where engineers can deliver great work. That means finding and hiring people who value great engineering but who also value professional and personal relationships. We are a global business, so your ability to work with people with diverse viewpoints and backgrounds will be important. As software engineers, we need to balance a lot of things. To us, "agile" means balancing software craftsmanship, operational excellence, and delivering value to our customers - while also allowing the team to plan work and life in a predictable way, work hard without needless distractions or fire drills, and spend quality time away from work.

   We take risks, but we hold each other accountable for results and how the results were achieved. We have a long-term vision, but we don't do big designs up front. Our goals are clear and we are working on things that are important to everyone on the team… and to Amazon.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on developing IDE experiences and enhancing developer productivity using generative AI tools like CodeWhisperer. While it mentions generative AI, the core responsibilities revolve around software development, user experience, and integrating AI features into existing tools, rather than building, fine-tuning, or deploying core generative models themselves. The emphasis is on the application and integration of AI for productivity, which aligns more with using AI tools rather than being a specialist in developing generative AI models. Therefore, it falls under the 'Ambiguous' category as it's primarily a software development role that leverages AI, rather than a dedicated GenAI Engineer role focused on core model development or deployment.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves 'crafting high-quality open source software', 'defining cloud-native IDE experiences', 'building backend services' (implied by IDE integration), and 'evolving the IDE experience', all of which are core software development activities.
The description emphasizes defining and shaping user experiences within IDEs, which is a key aspect of software development focused on the end-user.
The role involves shaping the future of IDEs for cloud development, indicating a focus on building and evolving software products.
job_tasks.phrase: shape the future of IDEs for cloud development

job_tasks.justification: The core of the role is to 'define cloud-native IDE experiences', which involves designing and developing software features.

The role requires understanding customer needs by interacting with developers globally to identify pain points and gaps in tooling, which is crucial for aligning technical solutions with user requirements.
job_tasks.phrase: identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling

job_tasks.justification: Analyzing telemetry to understand customer needs demonstrates a focus on data-driven insights to guide product development and business strategy.
job_tasks.phrase: Analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs

job_tasks.justification: Working with other teams across Amazon to provide in-IDE experiences for their services involves integration and development of software features.
job_tasks.phrase: Work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'On-Call responsibility' and the need to 'root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant' points to operational aspects of maintaining software systems.
Ensuring systems are 'resilient and fault-tolerant' is a key aspect of operational excellence in software engineering.
job_tasks.phrase: ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'opportunity to learn and grow as an engineer' directly indicates a focus on continuous learning and skill development.
job_tasks.phrase: opportunity to learn and grow as an engineer

job_tasks.justification: The role involves interacting with 'Amazon developers all over the world' and working with 'teams across Amazon', highlighting the need for cross-functional collaboration and communication.
job_tasks.phrase: Interact with Amazon developers all over the world

job_tasks.justification: The ability to work with 'people with diverse viewpoints and backgrounds' is explicitly mentioned as important for a global business.
job_tasks.phrase: work with people with diverse viewpoints and backgrounds

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions taking 'risks' and holding each other 'accountable for results', suggesting a culture of ownership and initiative.
job_tasks.phrase: take risks, but we hold each other accountable for results

job_tasks.justification: The need to 'identify and resolve pain points' and 'fill in gaps in tooling' directly relates to problem-solving.
job_tasks.phrase: identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'generative AI to help developer be more productive in their IDEs, including CodeWhisperer' indicates the use and integration of generative AI models, though not necessarily the core development of these models.
job_tasks.phrase: generative AI to help developer be more productive in their IDEs, including CodeWhisperer

soft_skills.phrase: opportunity to learn and grow as an engineer
